title: Casa T / SSAA
description: The project explores how living and working as a tattoo artist can coexist, uniting two distinct programs under one roof—an introspective working atelier and a warm family residence. Set on a trapezoidal site in a medium-density suburb of western Bangkok, the building turns its angular face toward a busy main road, shielding its interior behind minimalist surfaces. Designed in close collaboration with its owner—a tattoo artist known for his craft—the project goes beyond function, creating a space for expression, narrative, and creativity.
author: Miwa Negoro

title: House G+B / Mariana Orsi Arquitetura + Design
description: Designed for a young family and with an extensive program, the G+B House was born to celebrate. To celebrate gatherings. For this, we value common spaces. A large leisure area became the focal point of the project, turning into the heart of the house.
author: Susanna Moreira

title: The Stunning Cliffside Home That Makes You Feel Like You’re Living in the Trees
description: Tucked into the northern shore of Lake Tremblant, Canada, La Flèche is a contemporary residence by MU Architecture that reinterprets the traditional chalet through bold geometry and material sensitivity. Designed as a multigenerational retreat, it offers a lasting connection to nature and family in Quebec’s Laurentian forest.
author: Erin

title: HOCH & CHHO Transform a Former Hotel Into a Bold Tourist Residence
description: A former hotel in Paris' Montmartre is reimagined into bold tourist rentals by HOCH & CHHO with a postmodern and pop-laced sensibility.
